This is chapter 15 in our series in relation to the race riots in Wales.
This relates to Cardiff and is about the perpetrators, those arrested by the police and charged by the court with riotous assembly leading the riots, which is important.
Now the reason it's important is because mobs don't just happen.
You may have an instant flare-up but it doesn't continue for days and it doesn't continue on a whole range of different sites.
For that you need agitators, you need leaders, people who inspire a mob.
That's why the offence of riotous assembly is important.

There were 10 of them.
